It’s the Winter Soldier! He was just a bit too big, so I had to use 2 sheets of paper, even for just like, 3 rows of pixels. I did this one yesterday, after messing up three times. Its like they say, third time’s a charm! I used colored pencils to color him in.

title: Some Like It Hot
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2FGGs0V

by JenTheSweetie

A lot of stories start with “a man walks into a bar”, but these days a lot of stories that start that way end pretty badly.

Steve tries not to think about that too hard as he approaches the door off the alley just past the corner of 55th and Broadway. The alley smells like grease and garbage and everything else a New York City alley usually smells like, and when Steve opens the swinging door there’s nobody in the storeroom of the deli.

He takes a left at the canned peas, and the second door is there, right where his source said it would be. He tries the knob, and it turns easily and opens into a dingy staircase that nobody’s cleaned in a long while. It’s dark, and Steve wonders for a minute if they’re open, but then he hears it - the clink of a glass, the low murmur of conversation. He’s in the right place.

It’s not exactly reassuring.

title: Who I will write
body:
Feel free to request someone not on this list!

Tony Stark
Loki
Thor
Everett Ross
Clint Barton/Hawkeye
Phil Coulson
Steve Rogers
Scott Lang
Logan/Wolverine
Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto

A FYI: unless otherwise asked, any Avengers’ story will take place in the current timeline. The only thing is it will be after the snapture was fixed and Vision is rebuilt. And Loki and Quicksilver will be alive. Unless it’s a Coulson story. Then Loki will most likely be ignored unless requested.

As for X-Men: X-Men Origins will mainly be ignored except maybe to discuss Logan’s past. And take place in the rebuilt timeline.

And I don’t really write smut. Only because I suck at it. Love to read it; can’t write it. I’ll do light or suggested smut, but I honestly can’t write a sex scene to save my life.

title: Beautiful Nightmare 7
body:
Pairing: MC!Steve Rogers x Reader

Warning: Language. Violence. Gang issues. Bar brawls. Minor kidnapping. Bleeding. Nightmares.

A/N: I am still writing this. I’m not even sorry. It’s probably junk but I’m in a weird place lately and this is what I decided to write.

You escaped hell. Swore you’d never go back. You live a normal, typical life. Work, friends, home, till one night out changes everything in your life. Meeting Steve was not planned, but now he’s got his eyes set on you.
One date with him sends the two of you into a down spiral. You have to come clean about your past. But what’s hunting you, is it after you or Steve? Can you trust Steve and the Rebel Bastards MC or are you in over your head again?

Tag List Is Open!!

Your body was settled, a little numb around the edges. You couldn’t feel what Sam was doing much, occasionally there was a bit of pressure but nothing you couldn’t handle. Steve leans forward, his elbows resting on his thighs.

“You were pretty quick, hands on.” He nods.

“Just reacted.” You study the carpet under his feet.

“The tourniquet with his belt?” He lifts a brow.

“Um. I read a lot.” You shrug.

“As a librarian, I’m sure. But you’re not telling me the truth.” He nods.

“I am.” You avoid eye contact with him. You weren’t but you didn’t need to bring your past to light.

“Why do you know so much about club things?” He asks, leaning back, folding his arms over his chest. His massive arms are tattooed and straining his T-shirt sleeves.

“I don’t.” You swallow.

“You called us a club, not a gang. You knew we would have a medic or connections, and you said what I do is dangerous.” He calls your bluff.

“Oh, um. Good guess?” You mutter, still staring at the carpet.

“Are you in pain?” He leans forward suddenly.

“No.” You shake your head slowly.

“Y/N, you’re crying.” Steve’s voice dropped to a soft tone, his thumb brushed over your cheek, wiping the wetness from your skin.

“It’s been a really fucking stressful couple of hours.” You sniff.

“Right.” He nods slowly. “Sam’s almost done.” He glances over you at Sam.

“Then what?” You ask, pulling yourself together, tucking away your sadness. The lid on the box you kept it in had been disturbed, you straightened it and pushed it back to the dark corner it belonged in.

“Then my guys and I look into who took shots at us. Then we put an end to it.” He nods, his face so serious.

“And me?” You push up on your forearms, your head tipping.

“Right.” He stares at you for a moment, you look away flushing pink, you lick your lips and focus on the carpet again. “Well I’d rather know you’re safe, you already got hurt because of me, at least till we get these fucks. But I’m guessing you’re not one to be ordered around.” He nods, rambling slightly.

“I don’t like to be told what to do, unless I’m naked.” You smirk, Steve pauses, blinking before he nods slowly, humor in his blue eyes.

“Half way there.” Sam chuckles.

“The damn things you say, doll.” Steve chuckles softly.

“Sorry?” You smirk.

“No she’s not.” Sam laughs.

“You stay here, or I send one of my guys to be your shadow.” Steve was giving you a choice, but there was no third option and you knew that.

“I have work this week.” You sigh.

“Someone will accompany you.” Steve answers instantly.

“I’ll stay tonight, after that we’ll discuss this.” You agree.

“Oh don’t take it easy on me, doll.” He chuckles, Sam laughs.

“I didn’t get hurt because of you. I got hurt doing the right thing. You told me to stay down, I saw Peter bleeding out on a bar floor. There was no way I was staying under that pool table, why is my life more important than his? Doesn’t matter if it was Peter, Sam, or that really big guy who carries Peter like a baby. I wouldn’t have stayed down, but if it had been anyone else I probably would have gotten hurt worse, I wouldn’t have been able to move them.” You smile at Steve.

“How did you get hurt?” Sam asks softly.

“I was covered in Peter’s blood instantly. It just wasn’t stopping. I needed him out of the way, so I could work without thinking someone was going to shoot us. So I pulled him, but my sneakers were caked in blood, I slipped, must have landed on broken glass. I didn’t stop to check myself, I just yanked till we were covered, and went to work.” You shrug.

“Damn.” Sam replies softly. “You didn’t think about the bullets flying?” He asks.

“I waited till Steve returned fire. Scurried my ass across the floor as quick as I could.” You shrug.

“You know that was really dangerous, and you scared the fuck out of me.” Steve pulls your gaze up from the carpet.

“I heard you yelling, I just I didn’t see how my life meant more than that kid bleeding out. So I didn’t stop. If I was going to hide, I was going to do it and help him too.” You admit looking at him.

“Strange said he wouldn’t have lasted long, without the belt. Bullet was so close to his artery, one wrong move and he would have bleed out on the bar floor before the guys got there.” Sam explains.

“I knew. I saw how fast the pool of blood was building. I mean I was covered in his blood instantly, it was coating everything.” You look down at your hands, Steve had given you a couple alcohol wipes, but it only did so much to remove Peter’s blood from your hands.

“Peter is like a little brother to this whole club.” Steve places his hand on top of yours. “So believe me when I say, I can’t say thank you enough.” Sincerity in his blue eyes. You nod.

“Of course.” You nod.

“Done.” Sam announces.

“I’ll help you with the sweatpants.” Steve stands grabbing the clothes a pretty red head had dropped off.

“That’s going to be so fun.” You push yourself up as Sam helps you with the sheet, averting his gaze, but holding the sheet up as well.

“With the meds, you shouldn’t feel a whole lot. Just be careful you don’t rip a stitch, or you’ll be really sorry later.” Sam chuckles, looking over at the wall.

The room was simple, a burnt type of orange, brown color on the walls, you noticed a long row of cabinets at the other end, all pad locked. Hung over the back of chair is a bullet proof vest. You let Steve slip the sweats over your feet and up your calves, you pull them up the rest of the way as you stand up.

Steve’s leading you from the room, as another man jogs towards him. He has dark hair, grey like his facial hair. Panic and fear on his face, as he grabs the front of Steve’s shirt, Steve’s arm was in front of you as if telling you to stop, Sam moves in front of you.

“What happened, Rogers?!” He yells, Steve takes it. Letting the man melt down, he pulled at Steve’s shirt, his fists balled, pathetically hitting Steve’s chest. “How the fuck did this happen!?” He pleads, he looked so scared, your heart ached for him.

“Tony, he’s in good hands. Strange said he’d going to live.” Steve speaks in a clear, soft voice.

“He could have died!” Tony runs his hands through his hair.

“Actually with that type of wound you have ten minutes to tie it off, before he risks shock and dying.” You speak up, shifting when the three of them look at you. “I got to him in under four from him hitting the floor.” You shrug. “It was tied off and steady pressure applied in under eight.” You explain.

“Who is she?” Tony looks at Steve.

“Y/N.” Steve nods.

“She saved Peter today.” Sam explains. Tony looks weak with relief, he managed to get between Steve and Sam wrapping you in such a tight hug you stopped breathing for a moment.

“Thank you.” He sniffs.

“Tony. She’s a little hurt.” Steve pats Tony on the shoulder.

“Shit. Sorry.” He pulls away.

“It’s fine.” You tuck a strand of hair behind your ear. “Just cuts from trying to move Peter.” You nod.

“Fuck. Bless you.” His hands close around the sides of your head and he kisses your cheek quickly. Before he turns heading off into another room.

“Sorry about that.” Sam smiles.

“Peter’s dad.” Steve explains.

“Oh.” You swallow, a ball of something was lodged in your throat, you couldn’t think of anything else to say, so you followed in silence.

So I pulled him, but my sneakers were caked in blood, I slipped, must have landed on broken glass. I didn’t stop to check myself, I just yanked till we were covered, and went to work.” You shrug.

“Damn.” Sam replies softly. “You didn’t think about the bullets flying?” He asks.

“I waited till Steve returned fire. Scurried my ass across the floor as quick as I could.” You shrug.

“You know that was really dangerous, and you scared the fuck out of me.” Steve pulls your gaze up from the carpet.

“I heard you yelling, I just I didn’t see how my life meant more than that kid bleeding out. So I didn’t stop. If I was going to hide, I was going to do it and help him too.” You admit looking at him.

“Strange said he wouldn’t have lasted long, without the belt. Bullet was so close to his artery, one wrong move and he would have bleed out on the bar floor before the guys got there.” Sam explains.

“I knew. I saw how fast the pool of blood was building. I mean I was covered in his blood instantly, it was coating everything.” You look down at your hands, Steve had given you a couple alcohol wipes, but it only did so much to remove Peter’s blood from your hands.

“Peter is like a little brother to this whole club.” Steve places his hand on top of yours. “So believe me when I say, I can’t say thank you enough.” Sincerity in his blue eyes. You nod.

“Of course.” You nod.

“Done.” Sam announces.

“I’ll help you with the sweatpants.” Steve stands grabbing the clothes a pretty red head had dropped off.

“That’s going to be so fun.” You push yourself up as Sam helps you with the sheet, averting his gaze, but holding the sheet up as well.

“With the meds, you shouldn’t feel a whole lot. Just be careful you don’t rip a stitch, or you’ll be really sorry later.” Sam chuckles, looking over at the wall.

The room was simple, a burnt type of orange, brown color on the walls, you noticed a long row of cabinets at the other end, all pad locked. Hung over the back of chair is a bullet proof vest. You let Steve slip the sweats over your feet and up your calves, you pull them up the rest of the way as you stand up.

Steve’s leading you from the room, as another man jogs towards him. He has dark hair, grey like his facial hair. Panic and fear on his face, as he grabs the front of Steve’s shirt, Steve’s arm was in front of you as if telling you to stop, Sam moves in front of you.

“What happened, Rogers?!” He yells, Steve takes it. Letting the man melt down, he pulled at Steve’s shirt, his fists balled, pathetically hitting Steve’s chest. “How the fuck did this happen!?” He pleads, he looked so scared, your heart ached for him.

“Tony, he’s in good hands. Strange said he’d going to live.” Steve speaks in a clear, soft voice.

“He could have died!” Tony runs his hands through his hair.

“Actually with that type of wound you have ten minutes to tie it off, before he risks shock and dying.” You speak up, shifting when the three of them look at you. “I got to him in under four from him hitting the floor.” You shrug. “It was tied off and steady pressure applied in under eight.” You explain.

“Who is she?” Tony looks at Steve.

“Y/N.” Steve nods.

“She saved Peter today.” Sam explains. Tony looks weak with relief, he managed to get between Steve and Sam wrapping you in such a tight hug you stopped breathing for a moment.

“Thank you.” He sniffs.

“Tony. She’s a little hurt.” Steve pats Tony on the shoulder.

“Shit. Sorry.” He pulls away.

“It’s fine.” You tuck a strand of hair behind your ear. “Just cuts from trying to move Peter.” You nod.

“Fuck. Bless you.” His hands close around the sides of your head and he kisses your cheek quickly. Before he turns heading off into another room.

“Sorry about that.” Sam smiles.

“Peter’s dad.” Steve explains.

“Oh.” You swallow, a ball of something was lodged in your throat, you couldn’t think of anything else to say, so you followed in silence.

You escaped hell. Swore you’d never go back. You live a normal, typical life. Work, friends, home, till one night out changes everything in your life. Meeting Steve was not planned, but now he’s got his eyes set on you.
One date with him sends the two of you into a down spiral. You have to come clean about your past. But what’s hunting you, is it after you or Steve? Can you trust Steve and the Rebel Bastards MC or are you in over your head again?

“Just reacted.” You study the carpet under his feet.

“I am.” You avoid eye contact with him. You weren’t but you didn’t need to bring your past to light.

“Why do you know so much about club things?” He asks, leaning back, folding his arms over his chest. His massive arms are tattooed and straining his T-shirt sleeves.

“I don’t.” You swallow.

“You called us a club, not a gang. You knew we would have a medic or connections, and you said what I do is dangerous.” He calls your bluff.

“Oh, um. Good guess?” You mutter, still staring at the carpet.

“Are you in pain?” He leans forward suddenly.

“No.” You shake your head slowly.

“Y/N, you’re crying.” Steve’s voice dropped to a soft tone, his thumb brushed over your cheek, wiping the wetness from your skin.

“It’s been a really fucking stressful couple of hours.” You sniff.

“Right.” He nods slowly. “Sam’s almost done.” He glances over you at Sam.

“Then what?” You ask, pulling yourself together, tucking away your sadness. The lid on the box you kept it in had been disturbed, you straightened it and pushed it back to the dark corner it belonged in.

“Then my guys and I look into who took shots at us. Then we put an end to it.” He nods, his face so serious.

“And me?” You push up on your forearms, your head tipping.

“Right.” He stares at you for a moment, you look away flushing pink, you lick your lips and focus on the carpet again. “Well I’d rather know you’re safe, you already got hurt because of me, at least till we get these fucks. But I’m guessing you’re not one to be ordered around.” He nods, rambling slightly.

“I don’t like to be told what to do, unless I’m naked.” You smirk, Steve pauses, blinking before he nods slowly, humor in his blue eyes.

“Half way there.” Sam chuckles.

“The damn things you say, doll.” Steve chuckles softly.

“Sorry?” You smirk.

“No she’s not.” Sam laughs.

“You stay here, or I send one of my guys to be your shadow.” Steve was giving you a choice, but there was no third option and you knew that.

“I have work this week.” You sigh.

“Someone will accompany you.” Steve answers instantly.

“I’ll stay tonight, after that we’ll discuss this.” You agree.

“Oh don’t take it easy on me, doll.” He chuckles, Sam laughs.

“I didn’t get hurt because of you. I got hurt doing the right thing. You told me to stay down, I saw Peter bleeding out on a bar floor. There was no way I was staying under that pool table, why is my life more important than his? Doesn’t matter if it was Peter, Sam, or that really big guy who carries Peter like a baby. I wouldn’t have stayed down, but if it had been anyone else I probably would have gotten hurt worse, I wouldn’t have been able to move them.” You smile at Steve.
